author: Andria Carr Watson
title: Not User Friendly
content: I am not one to normally submit reviews but I was highly disappointed in this device. I understand that it’s not suppose to replace a tablet but it’s not user friendly. I wanted it for my kitchen to help me with recipes we all know how annoying your phone locking mid cook and having to unlock it to continue the recipe well if the recipe isn’t in Allrecipes and you open it in the browser when you walk away it closes the browser. If that’s not annoying enough when you tell Alexa to open up the browser again it doesn’t open the page you had so you have to search again. I did not realize you cannot do something as simple as Bluetooth to it which is disappointing for a 200$ Device, since I had the original audible I cannot even listen to books on it as my audible will not convert to Amazon. Honestly just not user friemdly for what I was expecting I will keep my dot for things like controlling smart home devices with my voice but am returning the show.

author: A. Prest
title: Does Not Show Caller ID or Caller name on the Screen
content:
If you hope to be able to visually monitor incoming telephone calls by using this in conjunction with an Echo Connect, forget about it. I have two Echo Show 2nd Generation units and two Echo Show 1st Generation units  and none of them show od say who is calling either with a name or a telephone number. All the screen shows and a voice says is "Incoming Call" with no visual or audio indication as to who is calling. Apparently, these features used to work but they no longer work. The Echo Connect is also supposed to announce the caller information on Echo units that don't have a screen, but that doesn't work either. For more information see the Amazon Forum about this issue. It looks like Amazon Tech Support ahs dropped the ball on getting this fixed. I just spent an hour on the phone with Amazon Tech Support and it looks like they haven't done much or anything to solve this problem
Check out the bottom of page 2 and all of page 3 on this Amazon Forum to read complaints that started on October 31, 2018:
https://www.amazonforum.com/forums/devices/echo-alexa/476517-echo-connect-talking-caller-id-not-working?page=2

author: Stephan
title: Great upgrade and worth the price
content:
Screen has light bleed issues and backlight consistently issues

EDIT
the screen is literal trash, i watch movies on it from prime video and the backlight is so bad. From the Gen1 they made some progress with the screen-glass distance but in putting a larger screen they made it of poor quality. This screen would be fine for a $50 tablet but not for this price. i know Amazon can do better We have seen it on the more expensive tablets (still cost less than echo show gen 2). Also in putting a larger screen amazon forgot to upgrade the RAM, GPU and CPU as a result this model is slower then last year's. Amazon took 2 steps forward and 3 steps back

Edit
My unit was defective and all issues involving the screen have been fixed! That being said this is an excellent way to control smart home. Passive bass radiator makes all the difference!
I wouldn't go as far as to say that amazon hit a home run with this one but they are light years ahead of the market/competition with this one.

title: Sound is great but that's about it
content:
The sound on this device is great, much better than the echo that I have. My major complaint is that the screen constantly tells you to try this, look at that, do this, do that.  It's so annoying and I've only had it for a day. I think you can turn the screen completely off but why should I have too.  Amazon needs to give it the flexibility to be customize-able and not just their way, stupid.  I personally think this will turn a lot of people off. Still undecided if I'm going to keep it.

11-20-18 Update  this thing is going on sale Thursday the 22nd so don't buy it until then!!!!!!!!!!!! Amazon told me today they would not refund me the difference and that I would have to return it and reorder. Stupid but what do I know.

author: Dennis
title: Great new product.
content: Love the larger screen and the sound is greatly improved.

author: STACY PADRO
title: perfect
content: we all love it, I can view the outside simply by asking alexa to view the area. My son loves talking to her

author: Josh C. Duyal
title: Sound quality.
content: Great sound quality. Needs more screen and type of clock choices.Amazon has to make Alexa communicate with ANY TV remote.

author: mark
title: Beware:
content: I thought that I say will be delivered in three days but its going to be weeks!  Alexa's a bad girl!

author: Dee D.
title: Arrived on time.
content: I like the size of the screen and it has great sound. but the Quality of the video is not the best. I will be checking with customer service.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great product!
content: I like everything about this product.I am very happy with my echo show.Allthough It can play pretty loud,I wished it had an output that could have been connected to a more powerful audio system,who knows maybe i’m probably Just a little deaf......

author: T. Graham
title: Great addition to our Alexa home.
content: Our home feels like an Alexa home, this and other Alexa enabled products work well together. I have one of the echos in my kitchen. It gives me hands free recipes i can read and music, movies,  tv show, ect. We also have reminders set on it.

author: Robert Couchman
title: Great sound quality!
content: Great sound! Amazing depth and clarity! I was surprised at how great the sound quality was... as good as Bose stereo!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Heavy duty and the volume on here is amazing!!
content: Scored this for 179$ and happy with the purchase sound quality is great picture quality is also amazing I love listening to music while cooking and cleaning and now I don’t need to touch my phone to lower or higher the volume or change the song lol I bug Alexa a lot since I’m home majority of the time. Wouldn’t change a thing about it going to purchase the white one next definitely a great buy for a good price

author: Kindle Customer
title: Understand what this is
content: I admit I thought I was buying a Kindle that also functioned as an Echo speaker.  It's my fault, but I'm going to return for a Kindle 10 and Show stand (which I understand has its own limitations).  I was shocked to realize you can't install apps like Netflix.  It's  an Echo Speaker with a screen. Everything works through Alexa and the cloud.  I’m sure it’s great for its intended audience but not what I was expecting.

author: BalletBabe
title: LOVE THIS NEW VERSION
content: I have dots, and the original echo and the first Echo show.  I love the larger screen and the sound is awesome also.  I highly recommend.  I am so impressed with Amazon service.  I was actual able to see where the delivery truck was, and a approximate time when my package would arrive.  They also took a picture of my porch where they left it.  I am impressed.

author: izod
title: No Netflix, slower than regular Echo, sound is OK.
content: Don't get wrong,  I like this device.. it is cool and has many uses.  Love the Silk Browser, visible alarm features, but i think it is a missed opportunity for some basic features that would bring it to the next level.  Such as, Netflix, a touch icon-based home screen, videos playing with Amazon music.  Its like Amazon forgets it has a screen.

author: Twepeh
title: Cannot search for pictures!
content: It should be able to search for pictures without my personal pictures being included.

author: J Dobson
title: I love my new toy
content: I was torn between getting the Google assistant hub or the Amazon Echo Show. I decided on the Echo Show and I do not regret my choice. I so love my New toy. My husband loves her too. I am in the process of connecting it to all my smart devices.  I can ask Alexa pretty much anything and she is able to provide me with the info I was looking for. I’m still finding out all the things she can do.

author: Helen C. Galasso
title: Love my Alexa Show
content: It’s almost like having a smart friend. I am impressed with how fast it answers your questions. I’m still learning what it can do.

author: Suzy
title: Read Directions
content: I gave this for Christmas.... Now I’m the best Mom Ever!!!

author: Stonington
title: A few things share the name......
content: This device just doesn't live up to the hype. Microphones are not good at all. Have to yell at it at times to recognize me. Also, when I try to turn off a device, say my bedroom light, alexa will say "a few things share the name bedroom light, which one do you want" when I only have one device named bedroom light. I can pick up my phone, use my tp link kasa app and turn it off no problem. This device needs some work before 5 stars can be given. EDIT: Changed to one star because of the microphones. I can be less than 1ft away and speak to it and it doesn't recognize me. This device needs a lot of work to compete with google.

author: Chao Chao
title: Very glad I waited for the 2nd generation
content:
When I first saw the Echo Show Gen 1, I was on the fence of getting it. Looked promising but the screen was a bit small for the price tag. Glad I waited for Gen 2! The screen on this thing is beautiful. Full HD and vibrant colors. I'm amazed that I can watch my Prime shows and it looks great. I also love the lyrics on the screen for Amazon Music. Sometimes I just want a solo karaoke session in my kitchen.
The sound of the Echo Show was what impressed me the most. I'm upgrading from a 1st Gen Echo Dot and the moment I heard the sound of the Show, I was blown away! There is so much bass and the volume can get insanely loud for such a little device. The kitchen might be my second most favorite spot in the house. Touchscreen is also very responsive and works great. The only thing I wish it had was an app hub so I can choose exactly what I want. Sometimes Alexa doesn't understand what I want to watch. Best Amazon machine ever!! Can't wait to see what other devices they release.

author: Raymond E. Stephens
title: Quick and effortless installation!
content: A pleasant surprise: finally, quick and effortless installation!  Basically, plug in and follow the prompts.  Sturdy build, great image, and dynamic sound.  Also, easy set-up of the Philips Hue bulb that came with it.

author: Jim G.
title: Love it...
content: As an early adopter of echos, I already had a few around the house, but wasn’t convinced the screen would provide much benefit.  We now love it, it cycles thru ‘this day’ pictures from the past years which bring a smile every morning. Like the videos for news briefing and the visual forecast for weather.

author: Amazon Customer
title: AS ADVERTISED
content: Better all around than generation one, I particularly love the larger screen

author: John Fonseca
title: Best in class
content: I very impressed by the video quality. Screen size and sound. I would highly recommend Echo Show 2nd Gen to my family and friends.

author: YURI
title: Newest edition is Awesome
content: Very nice, this is my third one, love them, grandson approved also for his bedroom, he can play his own music and watch different programs on it, great sound too, family loves them, great for security also just ask Alexa show me the front door, and there it is. You can even check on your house when gone, on your phone, ask her to show you your echo and you can talk or look to see what is going on in house...Cool!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Loved the multiple timers you could set while cooking. But not the glitches
content: I actually returned this item, I could only watch select prime videos and select Hulu videos, it did not have my list available and from time to time Alexa would not set timers and respond properly when asked stuff on a few occasions I had to unplug the power cord and plug back in for her to be responsive. For sure has some work needed to be done and I’d suggest getting Netflix and directv now service on it. Would of been the perfect size for my kitchen for cooking and videos but did not work out for me at this time, I think it’s needing much improvement before I would consider buying it again.

author: Ranger
title: Does it all
content: Nothing to dislike. We have it in the kitchen, so music interesting stuff and receipts give instructions and entertainment.

author: Thomas L.
title: Excellent product
content: Been in the hospital so haven't had an opportunity to use it very much. Expect it to function well like all my Alexa products

author: donnilou
title: Great Way To See Loved Ones
content: This product is wonderful to keep in touch with those loved ones that live miles away and too far to visit often. The only problem that I see is lighting.  There is no way to adjust the lighting and everything is dark and hard to see features of the person or people you are chatting with.

author: Ken S
title: Amazing tool
content: Great but still learning

author: looney
title: Needs internal battery for portability
content: I am really enjoying slowly adding smart devices to my home. I love the  versatility of this device. I purchased 2, and sent one to one of our children who is grown and moved out. It definitely makes for better communication with them. The only 2 design flaws I have are: first, it doesn’t have an internal battery. So if I want to move it from the living room to the kitchen, to follow a recipe, I have to unplug and set the whole device up there. 2nd, it dosent come with an integrated stand that you can control the tilt or swivel with. I had to order a separate stand, I. Order to adjust the angle so the camera could see everyone in the living room. Other than that, I love it

author: Michael J. Danberry
title: Beautiful sound
content: The Bose speaker makes the difference on the Echo show.  I stream Sirius / SM all day, and the sound is so much better than my previous Amazon Echo (original).

author: t.thompson
title: Quality and workmanship.
content: I love it. It does so much more than the Echo. It was very easy to attach all my other devices to my Show. Great picture quality and sound. It takes some time learning everything it can do but it’s worth the effort. I’ve already recommended it to my friends who have Echos. I also purchased the stand for the Show, it makes it more stable.

author: Amazon Customer
title: I enjoy using this echo show.
content: I can now "face time" my brother (we both have an echo), even though we have two different phones.  We both down loaded the app to our respective phones and gave echo access to our contact list. It was easy to set up. I enjoy using it for music also.

author: Tom
title: Mixed Review - 2 and 1/2 Stars
content:
Nice idea, but not fully there. It feels half baked, mostly because the screen in not very functional or useful.
I think this will be great for my mom to be able to make video calls and I've decided to give one of mine to her. I'll keep the other one to talk back and keep it it in the bedroom or office to replace the alarm clock.

To make this better Amazon needs to make the screen more functional. Just give us a control panel with different screens. Let us put the home automation controls in there so that I can view (and change) the settings of all of the items in my smart home setup. THAT is what this should be. Actually I've been using one of my Echo Shows in the same room as my Fire TV Cube and that setup is almost impossible. I just wish this was functional with the voice control turned OFF  and that this and the Cube could work together rather than against each other as this would be a perfect control/info panel. It already has all of the hardware necessary to be that--but the software isn't there. Not even close to there in fact.

author: James S.
title: BIG screen and better sound
content: The larger screen is great

author: Thomas Mooring
title: Good stuff
content: I like this new 2nd generation echo/Alexa. I had the 1st generation & it was fine. I use it to video chat with family.

author: Amazon Customer
title: just hooked it up
content: bought this for my wife for Christmas, she enjoys all of our other devices.

author: Seth
title: I have 2 but it needs software improvements
content: I have 2 but it needs software improvements because you will hear " I dont know that" many times

author: sue h.
title: Love the new screen size !!
content: Love the new echo show, this is my second one. I most often use it with wifi cameras to monitor my pigs in the barn.

author: Rick Sr.
title: Great Product
content: I agree with alot of the other positive reviews. Echo just keeps getting better.

author: Harvey G. Linkous
title: Great purchase!!
content: Purchasing this along with my other Alexa enabled devices to make my home smart, has been one of the best decisions I have made in years. It is a little bit expensive to buy all of the items however I think it is well worth it for the ease of life they have brought to my home. Been disabled it is very convenient to be able to use voice command for so many functions. I very much hope and look forward to improvements in the Alexa system in the future.

author: M. Young
title: Great sound, nice picture
content: Wish it had a headphone jack however.  My smaller Echo does.

author: Sean Devlin
title: Almost great
content:
Would be a five star review except for one major flaw that should be an easy fix.
I have the cloud cam in my nursery and use it as a baby monitor which works GREAT. I can view the camera on my phone, tablet, Fire tv (of which all our TVs primarily use) and now I can ask my new echo show to display the nursery as well which works great as a night stand monitor! Only problem is I also use Alexa to control various lights and switches throughout my house and when I ask my show to perform a smart home command like “turn off bedroom lights” when it’s time to go to sleep, it leaves my nursery cam then displays a control screen for whichever device or group the command was for. Which would be fine for a short while so long as it returned back to the nursery camera... it doesn’t... it displays the smart home control for a bit then goes to the home screen... forcing me to have to ask it to display the nursery again. This is very frustrating. As soon as this problem is fixed I will edit review to 5star.

author: zhangsu
title: Worth it
content: My kids like it very much. Video call, photo slides view and showing my ring doorbell/ Arlo camera are useful

author: Amazon Customer
title: Simple and Awesome
content: Theirs people that can't never be happy no matter what! I was really reluctant to buying amazon products like the alexa smart speaker, and echo show because I didn't like the idea of some one or something listening to what I say at all times but I can honestly say I was wrong. I just got my echo show and smart speaker yesterday and I'm already in shock of how awesome these products are simple to set up and use and the quality of the sound amazes me my echo show is as loud as my 55'in LG 4K TV its an amazing smart little screen that does the job I can now clean ,cook and have dinner while watching my favorite shows without having to touch or press anything. Just with my voice I'm able to jump directly to whatever interest me. I personally hate when people read the description of a product then go online after buying it just to complain about something they knew the product didn't have or couldn't do like Oh I purchase my echo show and I thought it was bigger then my 32"in tv but its not so I'm gonna give it 3 stars ...........

author: Cynthia Brandl
title: Love it
content: Love it! Works well with my other echo products

author: Charles C.
title: user friendly
content: This is a very simple device to set up and use on a regular basis.  It is much more responsive to voice commands than the original echo and the screen is very clear and responsive.  The only question I have is the amount of data that is sent over the wi-fi and consequently the internet connection.  Unfortunately I live in a rural area and am limited to 15 gig per month.  Something is eating my data limit in 5 days and I kind of suspect the new echo.

author: musicperson
title: Nice
content: My mom loves it so I'm happy.

author: Ek95
title: Great gift idea
content: My girlfriend loves it!

author: Alex R
title: Poor picture  quality , not a full HD
content: Now days , people are not even satisfied with 1080P and looking for 2k , 4k or 8k .  This device is not even 1080P and the pictures are kind of  dark most of the time even on the brightest mode.  the touch screen is also very weak , most of the time won't work, very difficult  to get You Tube, no app store, and .....  You cant even change the picture on your albums with the touch  and most of the time stock in one picture . Amazon need to reprogram  this device and for sure the new one should should have at least a full  HD 1080P.  I give it two star because of the sound quality only.

author: Richard A. Snyder
title: Best Echo Show Yet
content:
The overall looks are great and the sound is wonderful. The larger screen is worth the money depending on how you use the device. We have two of original Echo Shows, one in my study and one in the bathroom. Both are fine the those rooms. We also have a Echo Show Dot which is used as a bedside clock and controller.
All these devices work very well though sometimes we do have to reboot our modem/router when they lose connectivity.

author: Karen H.
title: Great assistant
content: I am very impressed with my new echo show 2nd generation.  It does everything promised and more.  Well done!

author: Jeremy B
title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
content: Doesn't have any sort of home screens, no apps. Nothing like a tablet and nearly useless. Cannot preform searches. I get real tired of hearing alexa say "sorry, i don't know that". Amazon has purposely blocked things like netflix, even through the browser. This thing should be able to do everything the fire tv can... you cant even shop on amazon with it normally. you get some weirdly watered down version of everything. My $50 fire tablet is far superior to this $250 POS. Not worth the money. The Echo plus seems to understand commands better and do more things. NOT AT ALL what you'd expect from an amazon device. Regretfully purchased.

author: Lisa A McEwen
title: Must have technology for family far away
content: This is such a great tool in ketoimg me in touch with the people I love who live far away. Great picture quality and connectivity.

author: Mike Martino
title: 2nd GEN is even better
content: Better sound and much larger screen in the second generation unit.

author: Antonio M Williams
title: Good in concept bad in reality.
content: Hard to get to YouTube. No apple integration for FaceTime or listening to podcasts / Apple Music. Basically useless except for ordering from amazon.

author: Tracy McKee
title: Bigger screen and sound quality
content:
Love the bigger screen but not quite as bright a picture as I was expecting.
Sound quality is fairly loud with a lot of bass. Would be nice to be able to control the bass levels.
All in all very happy with it.

author: lucy
title: Easy to set up and use
content: Great viewing quality and sound. Easy to use. We love it for video chatting with our granddaughter. I keep it in the kitchen and constantly ask it to find new recipes. Would highly recommend this device.

author: MarkInSJC
title: Loved the first one. Love this one even more!
content: Nice big bright screen and I added the stand to it. More appealing look and the sound improvement is notable. I would buy it again and would recommend it to a friend without hesitation.

author: Jose E. Rodriguez
title: Voice Recognition
content: I have a problem with Alexa's voice recognition; I listen to a lot of music, particularly music in Spanish, and Alexa misses or misinterpret a lot of my requests, and at times is unable to recognize artists or songs at all. Hopefully the development team is already addressing this issue.

author: Lori
title: Great design
content: Its amazing! The sound is so much more crisper and i love the large display.

author: Tom M. Giblin Jr.
title: Echo Show 2 is the Best!
content: Love ❤️ it!  I have the original echo show The new one is really awesome!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrible!!!
content: Terrible!!! Doesn’t “listen” as well as other devices. And if you want to use it for music eat all, the speakers/sound quality is far worse than a dot or other.

author: z
title: Great product that I love!
content: I love this product but I do wish it didn’t always have to be plugged in. When we play games it would be nice to be able to move it around and have it hold a charge.

author: Linh Ansboury
title: Not impressed by voice command quality
content: Great graphics. Big screen. Good volume. But I have to keep yelling Alexa and y’all slower than normal to ensure Alexa hears my command. For the amount of money, I shouldn’t need to keep repeating myself.

author: rosita
title: Big screen awesome sound!
content: Love it! Big screen, more bass great sound I enjoy listening my favs music. I recommend this to all.

author: K Lehn
title: Nice large screen, too much base
content: My first Echo Show was the first generation, so when I bought the 2nd generation, I figured it was an improvement.  Screen wise it is, speakers, there's too much base (there is an EQ, even with the base turned all the way down, still too much base).  The other issue is the speakers facing away from you, behind the device.  The first gen unit I could hear throughout my apartment at lower volumes, the second gen unit, I can't unless I really turn it up loud.  As I said my apartment, I use my Echo Show as an alarm clock, and listen to music while I wake up.  Getting back to the base issues, the last thing I figure my neighbors want to hear is the base coming from my Echo Show as base travels very well through walls.  So if you live in an apartment, and you wish to use this device as an alarm clock, I would advise finding a gen 1 Echo Show instead, as it's a much better choice, even with the smaller screen size.

author: phillip ludd
title: Clear sounds
content: Love the sound and accraucy

author: Audrey
title: The speaker quality is stunning
content: Love the echo, beautiful display and the speaker is phenomenal.  No regrets.

author: Tina
title: Still needs better screen and sound
content: Still not that great a screen and sound quality just not there yet. I wanted to love it but returned it.

author: Holly
title: Had Google Home first, was a waste of money, this is amazing!
content: Use on a daily basis, love how it controls everything I need.  Adding the speaker group with the Echo dots is amazing, music throughout the whole house!  Cannot say enough how happy we are with this.

author: Amazon customer
title: Surprised by how much we like this
content: We replaced our old Echo with this Show. We have been surprised by how much we like it. We received it as a package deal at Christmas when there was a good offer on a new Samsung Galaxy phone. We have been surprised how much functionality it adds to the Echo experience. It is great to see your shopping list on the screen, it is helpful to see your audio books, nice to see the lyrics for music that is playing. Also, it works as a photo frame showing us the family pictures we uploaded. All in all, we are thrilled with it. I would recommend it to everyone who already has the Echo (and I guess anyone who doesn't! at well.) It's a nice upgrade! It can do so many things.

author: Mark Kadrich
title: Easy to set up
content: Awesome little tool.

author: chris faisst
title: Five Stars
content: quick shipping, bought as gift, looks perfect

author: Brian Vierra
title: ALOT MORE THAN YOU WOULD THINK
content:
Easy hook up, easy to get and load app on other devices, easy to add more skills, I'm not a very good person when it comes to electronics so when I say it's easy I mean IT'S EASY.
We got ours for CHRISTMAS and I thought OH NO there's no way I can do this but here goes, plugged it in, followed the directions, got the app, within minnits I was workin it like a pro, music, movies, news, I even had my Daughter and her whole family on real time video talking n laughing like they were here (we live in Hawaii, they live in Orlando Florida ).
Now I'm using the app to create new skills for Alexa to communicate and respond to ALOT of of other things and it's only been a week, I haven't even started doing fraction of her capabilities, ALEXA IS AWESOME.

author: J. Daniels
title: good sound quality and easy to use
content:
I like the Show.  It's fun being able to see the lyrics of songs being played.  The sound is good.  The only issue I've seen that is a tiny bit annoying is that when I tell Alexa to turn off the screen, she does.  But sometimes when I walk in the room a while later, the screen is magically back on again.  There are only two of us living here and I know my spouse isn't reactivating it, so I'm not sure why it's happening.

One improvement I'd like to see with all the Alexa devices is the ability to pick my own WAKE word.

author: Verlinda
title: Ease of use and picture clarity
content: I looked how easy it was to set up and the picture clarity but the sound could be better.  I wished that it interfaces with devices not associated with Amazon.

author: Sue Lupus
title: Shipping takes time
content: Awsome

author: symbiology
title: How can you use it for recipies when it closes the browser every 5 fricking minutes?
content: Got this for the kitchen to use it to keep a recipe up while cooking and not have to walk into the room with the computer.  Totally useless and irritating for the function it is sold for, applications auto-close after 5 min. The whole point is  to have it display it without me having to reopen the stupid thing all the time and re-find my place. A paper book is more useful if they can't program it better than this.  The screen is always on and it uses quite a bit of power, I have to pull the plug to get it to "power save" not very green. Great sound for such a small package.  I would have skipped this purchase if I was aware of how badly the interface works.

author: Jacqueline Gibson
title: My right hand is far as information
content: Of the echo in the sound O my goodness the sound is wonderful a play my music a look up things are exit things the best

author: Jeanne M.
title: Beware - only steams Amazon /amazon prime shows and movies
content:
Great sound and visual quality.
Only problem which I did not realize at the time I purchased- you can only stream amazon /or amazon prime movies and shows. Needs to be upgraded to use with other carriers like Netflix,  PlayStation Vue as they have on the amazon TVs they currently sell.

author: Glenn T. Golcher
title: Larger Screen
content: This new show is a good improvement over the 1st model. The larger screen is sharper and easier to read the text. The speakers are much better. Thank you Amazo for upgrading this device.

author: Trudy
title: So glad I decided to reorder this.
content: I had ordered this and sent it back, without opening. So glad I changed my mind and reordered it. It was so easy to set it up and works with my Ring Doorbell and my Ring camera. I also finally got it to work with my Kasa plugs. The sound is great, playing music. I absolutely love it!!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Echo Show
content: I love my Echo Show.  I have instant access to the weather report, temperature, and music.  Also, because I have other smart home devices, I use it to turn my heat up and turn my lights on and off.  I keep mine in the kitchen; so I use it as a timer and to look up recipes.  At first I wasn't sure if it was something I'd really use, but now I wouldn't want to live without it!

author: QualityBuyer
title: The new Echo is bigger, clearer and louder
content: The sound and video quality is much better with the new Echo. The screen is also bigger. I just wish it had a battery and does not have to be plugged in all the time.

author: Andrew Wood
title: Good for home integration.
content:
Great product.  Now I can view my ring cams without finding my phone.

Music is great too.  The subwoofer is quite the monster.

author: Shannon
title: No front speakers! Very hard to hear
content: No front speakers. You literally have to stand behind it or bump it up against the wall for the sound to push forward. I very much dislike the new speaker design! I have to blare the volume in order to hear it now. I wish I had not upgraded from the 1st generation.

author: Shivarp
title: Data eater
content: I  have hardly used it for a week, but soon got a message from xfinity plan that more than 500Gb data consumed in a few days. No streaming, no video just a few voice commands!

author: anon
title: Works well
content: Had the old one and just wanted to upgrade.  Better screen but highly reflective.  Does a little more than the old one.  Great reminder, alarm and timer.

author: Amazon Customer
title: More uses than you think!
content: This was a last minute thought for my wife’s Christmas this year. I had seen one in Best Buy and thought “kinda neat gizmo” wasn’t sure how it would be useful. But when it arrived (right on schedule yay Amazon) it was impressive right out of the box. Not a techie here but I was able to get it up and running in minutes. The screen runs through suggestions that give you ideas for what you can do with it. I added Amazon music unlimited, which allows you to ask it to play any song you want. And I cannot believe the sound quality! I was watching Amazon prime movies right off the bat. Beautiful bright screen no buffering. My wife took to it immediately and seems to love it. We will definitely be adding accessories to start building a “smart home”, light and thermostat control. Nice when you’re getting ready in a hurry for work and ask for weather and calendar events. Impressive quality item, I haven’t compared the capabilities against the Google hub, but as a family that’s moderately connected with Amazon, I have to believe this a better choice for us!

author: Terri Bailey
title: Works with Ring doorbells and camera.
content: I'm a senior and it helps me with shopping lists and reminders of many things and announces when there is motion or a doorbell ring on my Ring doorbell 2 and Ring security cameras. We love it! Sometimes it has trouble understanding what you say to it but that could be because I wear dentures, LOL!

author: JudyAS19
title: Great Echo Device
content: Love my new Echo Show. The sound is great and the screen can be seen better than on Echo Spot. I love how I can have my photos cycle through like a digital picture frame. I liked it so much I bought a second one. It's a great Echo device.

author: Baker Mom
title: Great device, until it falls off its rocker
content:
This device does a lot of things well. Hardware aesthetics are elegant, sound is great (Not as good as my true studio monitors, but this is for casual listening), and the screen is crisp. The automatic screen brightness and far-field microphones work flawlessly so far. Other reviews cover its qualities very well.

I have two gripes with the device, one software and one hardware. My software gripe is that there are few options to change the time, weather, and suggested phrases on the home screen. I expect this will be added functionality in a future update. (Amazon, I hope your SDE's are reading these!)

I'd like to have an invocation button on the device as the Echo/Dot/Plus do, but that's minor, and something I knew before purchasing the Show. My hardware gripe is with the rubber base. I was playing music with notable bass at 80% volume. The device continued to shake backwards, sliding away from me, until it almost FELL OFF my painted ledge. The rubber needs to be thicker to absorb the lower frequencies to mitigate this. I hope Amazon will offer a fix for this to keep devices from falling to the ground below.

author: Commander Schlock
title: Out of the box I am not impressed. Usability is subpar, many skills are gimmicks
content: I have five Echo's and smart home stuff all over the house. I use my Echos daily for alarms, changing the heat/AC, lights, timers, weather, news and podcasts and as an intercom. I was expecting to be pretty happy with the Show, but out of the box it has potential that has yet to be realized, at least from what I can tell. First, I thought video news would be great. Reuters was what I tried. It plays, but then I ask Alexa to exit. Instead of stopping, it simply shuts off the video, but the audio continues to play. Seriously, this is annoying. I tried a few recipe skills and they were quite clumsy, difficult to exit and one even wanted me to sign up online. Hello, I want to do everything on the Show, not go to some website. Why is this so complicated? The constant stream of various headlines and "trending topics" is annoying. Can I shut them off? I have yet to figure that out. So, with all the hype on developing a "delightful user experience" why do we have to start from zero with a new medium/platform? Why can't Amazon or Skill developers apply good UI design and make this not just easy to use, but fun? I'll add more later, but first impressions do matter. My new iPad, Kindle and other devices were a lot of fun right away. This should be too. Sadly the experience is more like buying a fussy new printer than an innovative new device. I am returning this. It is nothing but a machine to play dumb games on.

author: Joel Steele
title: Obnoxious, Infuriating, Antiquated
content:
This device is by far the worst addition to the Echo family so far. The idea of a screen to communicate is shrouded with incessant messages, haptic feedback, miserable intelligence and overall inconvenience. You will be much better off buying a cheap iPad and using the Echo Dot so you can at least move it.

Ideas to improve for the next generation:
-IMPROVE THE TOUCH SCREEN
The screen is so unresponsive, I'd love to give up on it entirely. I have to press "buttons" on the screen five or more times for it to register. While I'd love to alleviate these woes with voice commands, the device is severely impaired and has selective hearing. Often times my commands won't even have a single understood word. As much as I'd like to tell my Echo Show to "stop giving me command options," it won't "know that."
-Display options
If I have to see one more "Try, Alexa, tell me something weird" prompt, I might throw up. You're a passive device, not my reluctant friend with ADD.
-Improved syncing:
While your speakers are marginally better than previous Echo devices, the connection between devices to have multi room music is awful. They are not in sync and it sounds collectively distorted and unpleasant to say the least.

Can I have my money back?

author: J. Harris
title: Echo Show and Ring - Home Automation at it's best. Perfect for elderly parents.
content:
I bought the Echo Show two-pack at a great price because I had recently purchased Ring doorbells for our house and our parents home. We wanted to be able to see who was at the door in either location before having to go answer the door because stairs in a split-level home are becoming more of a problem as they age.

I also wanted our parents to be able to see who was at the door without having to worry about constantly carrying a phone or finding it every time the doorbell rang. The Echo Show  just sits on the table near where they sit most of the time and a simple voice command can let them see and talk to whoever is there.

Although it kinda seems like 'spying,' it also gives us peace of mind to know that when our daughter is supposed to pick up Grandpa at 1:00p for his doctor appointment, she actually shows up on time. We have video evidence of the comings and goings at our parent's home.  And if she doesn't show, guess who is getting an emergency 'get your butt over there now'  call!

I work from home, so I placed the second unit in my upstairs office so I can do the same thing... see who it is and determine whether I have to drop everything to answer the door.  If a signature is required on a package, the carrier at least knows someone is on the way down, and I don't have to go to the post office to pick up 'missed deliveries.' This alone made it worth the cost of the Show in time saved going to the post office 2-3 times a month.

As an added benefit, my father-in-law likes to follow the markets, and Alexa can intermittently and automatically show him any stocks or market conditions he's interested in.

Echo Show makes caring for elderly parents so much easier and relieves a lot of worry about 'not knowing'.  We use the DROP IN feature to check in with them occasionally.  They do the same with us if they need anything. Any of the Echo/Alexa setups can do the same thing, but sometimes there is no substitute for being able to see the other person.

And finally, as one of many other added benefits, with Alexa no question goes unanswered, and with Amazon Music there isn't a song they can remember that they can't hear again on a moment's notice.  They often wonder who an actress is on an old movie and as long as you know the name of the movie you can get a list of cast members for pretty much anything.  And last Christmas we were over there and heard coming from the other room, "Alexa, play Burl Ives Christmas music." (Now there's something you don't hear every day....)  But by golly, Burl Ives Christmas music came up with lyrics, and the room was filled with "Holly Jolly Christmas" and a lot of other great old songs I'd never heard.  It made them very happy.

author: Daniel C
title: Echo Show is My Choice
content:
Wow! Deciding between Echo Show and Google Home is tough because most reviewers don’t own either. I finally decided on Echo Show because it controls more things, allows video chats, has a bigger screen, and gives me extras at no cost because of my Prime Membership (like Amazon Music).

Be aware that you need to decide which control convention to go with (Z-wave or Zigbee). I chose Zigbee because the switches and plugs that use Zigbee seemed to be a little cheaper than Z-wave devices. That means Echo’s higher cost can be offset by cheaper accessories. As you add more items, the difference adds up.

WiFi controlled devices will work with either Echo or Google but could begin to slow down your Internet due to traffic jams in your router. Z-wave and Zigbee apparently don’t go through the router.

Also be aware of the feud between Amazon and Google is kind of like between Sony’s Beta Max VCR and the VHS format. One will win and half of us will be left with outdated technology.

Smart ahome setup is beyond the capabilities of most home owners and you may need the help of a Tech Guru at additional cost. But if you just want to plug it in and surf while you cook, it’s not too hard to do.

Being able to check who’s at the front door, see when packages arrive, remotely control lights, are all easier for those with limited mobility, but they still need enough tech smarts to be able to make it work. Probably not a good option for a Grandparrent who doesn’t know how to use their smart phone.

author: Matt
title: What are you really going to use this for?
content:
There is a delay in audio from my iPad to the Echo Show via Bluetooth so when I play video on the iPad, the sound from the Echo Show doesn’t sync with the video. I didn’t have this problem on the original Echo Show. The 2nd gen Echo Show screen is definitely larger and more vibrant.

Overall it’s not that useful unless you are going to watch something directly on it. It has Prime Video, Hulu and for some reason, NBC. Without Netflix, this makes it a light offering. The content (like news stories) it pushes out is rarely relevant to me. If you like following cooking recipes on tv, then this is probably good for the kitchen.

Alexa has all the same problems she has on every other Echo device, most frustratingly she can barely answer questions about what the device can do. Instead she either refers you to a help section that mysteriously isn’t available on the device itself even though it has a screen or she just says something like, “Hm, I don’t know that.” One improvement on Alexa’s shopping skills, particular to this device, is that you can look at the products, though it’s a narrow set.

content: I really like this device it resides in my Kitchen The Alexa functionality is good and getting better all the time. Sound and screen size is pleasing but like the rest of the device, it could use improvements. My two main complaints are #1 the is lack of multiple users control and #2 tablet type functionality.  If you want to make a call you can only pull from one address book which is cumbersome for a device meant to serve a home as a centralized device. The device is limited to the echo show mode and Aleza only and has no tablet-style functionality like adding your favorite apps which is limiting at best and a gross omission at the very least. I do hope the platform improves overall. Look at it this way if I want to add a new Hue or smart thing device I have to pick up my Fire HD 10 or phone or laptop to add it so Alexa can control it because the Echo Show is useless in this regard. Not what I expected and I'm sure very frustrating for many less tech-savvy DIYers.

author: Night of Starz
title: Skill Set LACKING
content: Oh boy, what a mistake I made buying this.... I just don't get the disparity between the marketing to skill set of the equipment - this product seems to be a donosaur pre-release of something that could be good that's coming in the future that we don't get to have or enjoy because we bought the lesser functioning version FIRST. NO HOME SCREEN TO CONTROL THE MACHINE & it's capabilities are non-existent to VERY DIFFICULT to harness or control in ANY way. I would not have bought this had I known. I would like Amazon to give us updates that improve this machine, like allow WEB SURFING & an actual home screen to control this machine. Even if I watch Days of Our Lives online episodes, all it allows is to go forward or backwards but not to control a 'refresh' option when Alexa Show goes frozen for hours during a commercial or show... this product I thought was going to be sci-fi-fun absolutely perfect advanced technology - this system IS SO LIMITED IT'S a NIGHTMARE to try to operate.  Voice commands are so minimal in scope and ability, I was shocked. What an overpriced product for just a wonderful speaker and a dinosauric operating screen even if it does have touch screen.  Like I said, you can't refresh anything, you can't ask it to find a business, or a local transportation website  which seem to show that it does not access the actual entire World Wide Web which is just loaded with useful information ti draw upon  - no web surfing at all through it. In other words, it can't even do what the web can and go to a place to get you the information it couldn't give you. It had a hard time finding my purchased amazon music, it can't go to a website, it can't play online episodes well of things: IT FREEZES and no refresh button, no controls, no voice capabilities with these things. Alexa show also asks you to link your home computer though vicky something when you try to get it to reach a website, then cannot link your computer when you follow the instructions for that - there's something wrong here - Amazon, where is the complete list of what this product even does other than weather or something very miniscule? I am shocked, I thought this would be sci-fi type fun it would be so advanced & am just shocked at how very little this Alexa Show can do. Positives are it does play really good radio stations and you can ask it to tell you how to say some common foreign language sentnces or words.

author: Jesse K.
title: About as much functionality as an Echo Dot with a Screen...
content:
I was super excited about receiving the 2nd Gen Echo Show today. But, after spending a few hours with it, I’m not that impressed. I’ll start off by saying the sound quality and output is amazing, other than that, I’m struggling to find a good use for it. I’ll give a full rundown below:

Backstory:

This is my first “screened” echo product. Originally, I was thinking this would have similar features to an android tablet. I wanted to use it in the kitchen and run some of my cooking/recipe “apps” on it. I somehow missed the memo that the Show is essentially an echo dot with a screen, and you can only choose from the limited “Amazon Skills” selection from the Alexa app using voice control. *In full disclosure and “TMI”, I’m on a strict low-carb/ sugar-free diet - the native recipe skill is almost useless for me...*

I know, I know, you can watch prime and other videos on it, but I have no idea why you would want to watch something on a 10” tabletop screen when your TV is 10x bigger, or on a tablet that's 50x thinner...

There is almost zero personalization available and everything seems to be locked down. Heck, I can’t even select items or information (like 5-day weather, news, calendar) to display on the home screen. Unless I’m missing something here, looks like the whole operating system literally just runs off the voice-controlled “skills”.

Out of curiosity, I went ahead and ordered the Fire HD 10” tablet with “Show Dock”, and I'm glad I did... With the Fire Tablet, I'm able to run the apps I like and it's completely mobile. I don't have the sound quality that the Show had, but this can easily be fixed with a nice Bluetooth speaker.

author: ITsTheXFactor
title: Amazon Finds the promised Land
content: It's a vast improvement on the original Echo Show in aesthetics and audio quality, and it delivers most of what was missing from its predecessor for the same price. If you're decidedly on team Alexa, this smart display is the one for you. The second generation Echo Show is miles ahead of the original, but many of the first generation device's characteristics remain.  Four microphones on the front of the device and four on the top only slightly change the look of the controls. As for better hearing, Alexa heard me the first time with the new Echo Show at distances where I had to repeat the wake word three or four times on the first generation unit, Also The redesign brought much-needed change which makes me a lot more likely to want an Echo Show on display in my own home. the second generation Echo Show sounds much fuller, deeper and just plain better than both its predecessor and the Lenovo Smart Display. That's true for video chatting, online content and music streaming. Yes, a Google Home or HomePod will still win out for room-filling, quality sound. But for a smart display the new Echo Show is no slouch. Speaking of Fire TV, the Echo Show will integrate with Fire TV Recast to put live TV on the Echo Show as a recording .Fire TV Recast is a DVR setup for your smart display. Not everyone will value watching real TV on a smart display, but if nothing else, Amazon is taking the logical step of marrying its video services to its video-capable hardware.

author: D. Solberg
title: Nice product, but the interface isn't there quite yet.
content:
This is nicely designed hardware. Pulling it out of the box, you get a sense that you're buying something of good quality. It has good, loud speakers, and a reasonably nice screen. I was pretty excited.

Unfortunately, the user interface let me down. I can feel the huge potential for this product, but every time I tried to do something, I was stymied in some way. It's not like it's a bad interface, it's more like it's not finished. For example, the home screen seems like it would be a great way to check on my day. I'd like to see a forecast for the today and maybe the next couple of days on the main screen. The other half of the screen could show maybe sports scores or news headlines, or maybe the status of all the connected lights in the house, or maybe a touch screen of quick actions to jump to recently used stuff.

None of that is available. You can get a rotating view of news headlines, but you can't pick your source. You can see sports information, but for some reason it only shows my local football team, and there's no way to choose. This would be a perfect heads up display, but the rotation of elements means that you'll have to stare at the screen for a long time before what you need pops up. Again, lots of potential, but not there yet.

Another thing to do with this is watch videos in the kitchen when you're cooking. This works okay, but everything about choosing and finding episodes in clunky and unfinished. For example, I wanted to watch the next show in the series I was watching, but for some reason, it went to the first episode. I could not see any way to go to the episodes list so I could choose the next episode, and I didn't know the correct number, so I couldn't try asking Alexa.

I thought about keeping it because if Amazon keeps iterating on the UI, someday it could be quite useful. However, at this point, it's well-designed hardware with software that frustratingly just wouldn't do what I wanted. I also considered keeping it because it works with the Fire TV Recast, but in the end, the hard to use interface was just a little too much to overcome, at least for now.

title: Useless user interface
content:
There seems to be a reason Amazon is giving these devices for free.
The device is great looking and sounds pretty good.
HOWEVER, that is where everything stops.
The user interface for Alexa and Echo is absolutely garbage.
I tried to find another word to not be too crude, but, I couldn't.
Amazon, I'm sorry. I'm a huge fan of your great customer service and products.
Why did you design such a useless device from the ground up?
Say you want to play some songs on your pandora, well you will need to use at least 2 devices. You have to configure the station on a computer after going into 10 subselections (really well hidden). Then start pandora with a voice command on your Echo show. That absolutely defeats the purpose of having a smart speaker with a user interface.
Amazon, please allow people to use the screen on the echo show to configure apps, otherwise you sold a very good looking paper weight.

author: Brian M.
title: A Great Upgrade From the 1st Gen Echo Show
content:
I’ve really liked the 1st generation Echo Show and so when I say the features of the 2nd generation I quickly preordered it. I replaced all 4 of my 1st generation Echo Shows with 2nd generation Echo Shows and repurposed the older ones.

The screen is a big improvement on the 2nd Gen, you can really notice the size difference and the new screen looks a lot clearer. We use this for streaming cameras too and as a baby monitor and night and you can see all the detail you need to see.

The sound is improved as well. I listen to Pandora pretty much all day long on the Show in my office and for the size and footprint of it the sound quality is great. I will say the one thing I noticed, as far as audio goes, when you ask Alexa to turn up/down the volume vs. using the button the voice command jumps what seems to be a couple steps and I find myself having to go over and turn it down manually if it has gotten too loud. I get around this gernally by saying a specific level i.e. “Alexa, set the volume to 4”.

Overall I’m very happy I upgraded to the 2nd generation Echo Shows!

author: Barry S
title: Great Concept Needs Software Update
content:
I've had the Show for a little over a week. This thing has great potential, but it sorely needs a software update. If you think about it, it really does not do anything useful. Most of the time it just sits there. You need to be able to customize the home screen background and size of the time / weather. It could be a fantastic, basic, smart home controller, but it fails on that part. You need to be able to map addresses. You need an option to not show this "Try" nonsense at the bottom of the screen - that is just veiled advertising. It needs more thought put into accessibility features. I just tried: "Alexa, show me the nearest pizza places" as prompted by one of their "Try …" suggestions. It showed me 8 sample pizza offerings from different places, but did not state the distance. I tapped on one of the pizza offerings, it showed the distance, but would not let me map the location. If I want to order a pizza I would have to go to my computer – why bother with the Show?

*** After 4 weeks ***

This product has so much potential, but the implementation is garbage. It should never have been released for sale. The reality is it's just a tabletop dust collector – it does nothing. Most of the time it just sits there. It would be useful if it showed the time, day, and date on the home screen. It does show the time, but the font is too small to be useful and it's not configurable. It doesn't show the day or date. It shows an icon with the current weather and temperature, but again it's too small to see across a normal-size room and it's not configurable. 90% of the screen real estate is wasted. At the bottom they have an advertisement for "Try: Alexa…" And this can't be removed. After the first 15 minutes of "Wow", this gets old really fast.

The bottom line, in its present state I definitely could not recommend it to someone. If they fixed the software with some of the many complaints you see on the Echo Devices forum, it could be really good and useful.

author: ChiefB

content: Nice package but really poor fidelity in sound. Bass is fluttery, grumbling at medium volume. Far from "Premium Sound". Video is excellent. Backgrounds are nice but boring, especially the predominate color... pea green and faded blue. The background paintings/drawings are generally uninteresting. There is no indoor temperature sensor.  There is a way to disable/enable the camera without disabling Alexa's monitoring ability.... just ask. "Alexa" could be way more intuitive and flexible in her understanding of questions and not require rote regurgitation of question formulation on subsequent questioning or requests. There must be some way that we humans can be relieved from Alexa's demand of complete and accurate remembrance/recollection of original task setup terminology for the myriad of tasks/requests we develop over time. We are not all "Watsons" but simple Earthlings. That's my review (so far) and I'm sticking to it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Amazing.
content:
The commercial where the daughter burns the dinner before her date arrives and her dad helps her out via video on the Echo Show literally makes me tear up every time.  My dad is not able to help me with things like that.  He has dementia and has trouble walking.  I am his daughter, but live six hours away from his nursing home.  We used to talk on the phone all the time, but now he has trouble answering his cell phone and indeed yesterday left it in his pants, washed it and the cell phone died.  I could not talk to him as I wanted. He was not able to answer video calls via Alexa without me reminding him on his cell to push the answer button.  But now, Thanks to the Drop-In feature I can just video call him anytime without him having to answer and the nurses have left a note telling him what to say so he can drop in on me and his two beautiful granddaughters when he wants.  Now, we spend hours together.  It is nothing short of a miracle to see his and my face and his granddaughters faces light up as he is able to interact with my family EVERY  SINGLE  DAY. You have brought our lives JOY and i cannot thank you enough for this innovative technology and the ease with which to operate it.
My kids and family adore every single feature and we are getting to know more and more about what it can do.
Thank you sincerely from the bottom of our hearts.

author: Barry
title: Won't play YouTube Videos 2nd Update
content:
Received 2nd generation Echo Show as Christmas gift.  Was very excited about placing device in kitchen to watch YouTube.  Unfortunately, YouTube videos stop playing after 5 minutes and return to home page screen making it useless for this purpose.  Other web videos have trouble playing as well.  Video starts and after about 5 seconds starts over in endless loop.  I wouldn't recommend this product until they fix the video play problems.

Update #1 (1/4/19): Was contacted by Customer Service and was advised to unplug Echo Show for approximately 1 minute and then plug in again.  This action seemed to have fixed the problem as videos on YouTube and other Websites now play properly.  Therefore, I am revising my Overall Rating from a 1 to a 5.

Update #2 (1/5/19):  All problems came back when tried to play videos again.  In addition, screen became locked on video page with no way to exit.  Alexa commands didn't work.  Contacted customer service and Echo Show was factory reset.  Videos still didn't play properly.  Will probably try to return device.  Too bad.  Great idea for product, if it worked.  Revising review back to 1 star again.

author: B. Flanagan
title: Waiting for updates
content:
I have had multiple Echo devices, including the first generation Show. This is definitely an improvement on that, bigger screen, better music and sound, and video. However, more than any other single function, we use it as a digital picture frame. The background picture, when the device isn't being used for something else, can be set to an album that you have created on Amazon Photos. We loaded 400 or so photos, and they change at about one minute, which I think is a perfect time.

There are a couple of problems, though. First, the units have a tendency to stop and stay at one picture, until the unit is unplugged and plugged in again. This has been mentioned time and time again in reviews, but the Amazon team on this project has apparently either not prioritize it, or can't fix it. Expect this to continue until they make it a priority.

The second issue with this as a digital picture frame is that there's no customization, other than selecting the album. Pictures rotate chronologically, either by date taken or date uploaded. You cannot shuffle or randomize. So if you took a bunch of photos at a birthday party or wedding, you are going to see all of those pictures in succession, before it moves on to another. It's gotten to the point where I can predict what the next pictures going to be.

Also in the category of lack of customization – there is no effects that you can use with these pictures. There is no transition choice – fade,, wipe, side – nor were there any effects that can be used (Ken Burns, etc.) Amazon doesn't give you any kind of slideshow maker, and it doesn't support any third-party apps.

In the general category of Alexa – the skills have now become like Apple's app store. You can't find anything useful unless you read something about it somewhere. It suggests skills, based on one's you have already enabled. We tried that once. "Big sky" is a weather app that's pretty good. Around Christmas time, it was suggested that if we like that, we would like something called "Sky Weather". So I enabled it by voice. And then opened it. It went on for about two minutes. And Alexa did not appear to hear me calling for it to stop, so I had to scream. No more suggestions.

My home isn't smart enabled, so I'm not going to comment on its usefulness on that front. The recipes are definitely helpful, but I don't think I'll be watching much video on it. Simply finding your Amazon purchases can take time, and there's only a limited number of them that show. Finally, the "drop in". Nice idea, but these are usually going to be sitting on kitchen counters or side tables. You're going to have to squat down. In an age where everybody has an iPhone or iPad and Facetime is available, it's an inferior redundancy. (Oh, and it can be really annoying. I gave these to 2 sisters and a niece at Christmas. One of the sisters sent me a message. Suddenly, the Echo Dot next to my head started glowing and fading, glowing and fading. I couldn't figure out what the hell it was. So I could sleep, I just unplugged it. Next day, I saw other Dots glowing and fading, and went into the Show to find out what the heck was going on. Apparently it was the message, and it doesn't stop until you read it. Thanks, but I think I'll stick to texting.

author: Drew Anderson
title: Presumptive and somewhat Infuriating device
content:
Updates:  I have updated this and I gave it another star.
There is an Amazon-produced youtube video that is worth watching.  However
it isn't in the Amazon help, and it isn't referenced by any of the Amazon help.
It gives some of the basics of the device.  I found it on google.
You can find it by searching for "Echo Show Basics" and it is about 3.5 minutes long.
If you watch the video, the device will be less infuriating and can easily be made
less presumptive.

In the book "1984" there was a telescreen.  It was always listening.  Always watching.
I always wondered how these devices might come into existence and into peoples homes.
I think that I just bought one.  Maybe I'm just afraid that I just bought one.

BTW, I do have an Echo, and I like it.
The Show, however, is another story.

The default mode is for it to be constantly doing something on the screen,
switching between "cards" which present separate types of information.
I spent most of today searching for or figuring out how to turn things off.

The home card/screen starts out with lots of stuff turned on. (That is the presumptive part.)
Trending topics, sports scores, upcoming events, Discovery with Alexa are all on, but you
can turn them off.
The one thing you cannot turn off is the Try "Alexa, ..." hint at the bottom of the screen
I searched for hours on how to turn this off.  It even displays when you are listening to music.
(This is what "infuriating" is referring to in the title!)

The default mode when playing songs is to show the lyrics.  There doesn't seem to be
a setting in the any of the various settings options to change this.  However, if you tap
the progress bar for a song while it is playing, it will bring up controls.  There is a "Lyrics"
button.  I'm sure I just dense, but it took me a while to find this.

I also feel much more paranoid about the camera than I thought I would, even with it disabled.
I am not very happy with the device and wish that I never bought it.  Hopefully, it will improve over time.
I understand that some competitive devices have a shutter.

Some things I do like:
The multiple timer screen is pretty nice.  But, if you set a timer on one device, the other device doesn't know about it.
Sound is pretty good.  Another reviewer mentioned that the movie volume is noticeably less than the music or Alexa volume.  I also found this to be true.
The display is good.

Some things it doesn't suggest, but should:
"Alexa, go home"
"Alexa, go to settings"
"Alexa, turn off screen"
"Alexa, stop streaming"  This will cause it to release the stream so that another device can stream something.

author: DILSHAN BOTEJU
title: Best Echo Show thus far!
content:
Owning a Echo show 1, Echo Spot, Echo plus , dot etc etc , I was on the waiting list for the all new Echo Show. Having now got it, i must admit that its a must have at every home. Compared to the Show 1, the screen size is a big improvement while HD quality display makes watching the Show 2 a pleasing experience.
The sound quality is far improved with an in-depth Base sound on the new Echo show. The touch panel is also more sensitive and responds to even a slight nudge.
I received the Echo Show 2 with a one months Hulu Subscription. Now that's what i call music! This Echo Show plays all our favourite Live TV channels (CNN, Fox, Cozy, Boomerang for kids .......) available on Hulu. This is indeed a new chapter in Television entertainment. In addition, Echo Show now has apps that can also play back some free to air Live News and entertainment channels.
I have so far no negative feedback on the product. I did however noticed that once connected to a Bluetooth speaker (in my case to a Yamaha bluetooth), there was a little lagging in the sound track. This is not the case with Echo Show 1. Maybe at the next software update, Amazon can fix this minor concern.
As always, A great product from Amazon. Try it Guys - it's sure worth the price!

author: Sherry
title: Frequency of signal hurts dogs ears - please provide a remedy Amazon
content: Hey Amazon - can you please  look into thee frequency issue with the Echo and Echo Show?  There are forums lamenting how dogs are adversely affected, they cower, tremble and hide in fear.  Someone on an amazon forum put an ultrasonic frequency detector on their devices (Echos, Dots, and Spots) and found they all show a significant amount of energy just above the 20KHz range when Alexa responds. They believe this is probably what dogs are hearing.  I have an Amazon Echo and an Amazon Echo Show.  I would really like to use them and say good things about them, but my golden retriever shakes profusely and hides any time I turn either of them on.  Please please Amazon...please find a remedy for this.  TY

author: The Review Dude
title: An improvement, but not without some quirks.
content:
The actual hardware has improved.  The sound quality on this Echo Show is definitely better than the first generation.  The screen is bolder as well.  I own a first generation Echo Show as well... I do not love the new software update that hit all Echo Shows.  For example, if I set my background to show my family photos from Amazon Photos, I do not want to see stock photos of news stories as well!  I know I can turn off updates in my settings... BUT I like the words from the updates, I just want them over my photos like the old Echo software!  As it stands now, a family picture will come up, then a news story photo.  This is quite annoying!

I do not know how long Amazon will rule this market.  The new Google Hub looks like a great device.  However, the inferior sound and lack of a camera still puts it behind the Echo Show.  But in a couple years if a Google Hub Max comes out... I may switch to that!  The Google brain just is outpacing what Amazon’s articfical intelligence can do. (I have both Echos, Echo Shows, and Google Home’s in my house!)  Facebook also just released an interesting device similar to the Echo Show that lets you video message FaceTime Messenger contacts.  But as of 2018-2019, in my opinion, this is the best device of its kind on the market!  I’m very happy with this Echo Show compared to the first generation Echo Show!!!
